{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient developed symptoms 5 days after an emergency appendectomy under general inhalational anesthesia. The symptoms include low-grade fever, vomiting, and abdominal pain, along with jaundice and hepatomegaly on examination. Laboratory studies show elevated liver enzymes and bilirubin levels.
